alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 3:38AM CST until March 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slushy Snow Moves In Tonight... .Wet, slushy snow is expected to move into the region this evening and into Monday. Much of the snowfall looks to remain north of Interstate 94, with a few inches of snow accumulation possible north of Interstate 90. Warmer air will move in with a wintry mix before the precipitation changes to rain or mixes in with rain. A slight shift south has been noted, so additional refinements may be needed with future updates. Travel impacts are expected with the falling snow and brisk east winds gusting to 25 to 35 mph tonight and Monday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
